product_overview: OrderFlow Management System is a comprehensive web application designed to streamline order processing, inventory tracking, booking management, and customer communication through an integrated dashboard and advanced data management tools.
core_goals: Provide a unified platform for managing orders, inventory, bookings, and customer calls.
Offer real-time visibility into system status, order progression, and inventory availability.
Enable efficient workflow automation, such as auto-moving VINs to call lists when parts arrive.
Facilitate easy data access and editing with dynamic data grids and reusable UI components.
Support historical data management and restore functionality through an archive system.
Deliver enhanced search across multiple data domains including VINs, customers, and parts.
Ensure responsiveness and usability with a modern UI built on React, Next.js, Tailwind CSS, and Radix UI.
key_features: Dashboard displaying key statistics, various charts, and calendar overviews.
Robust Order Management including bulk operations, modals for notes/reminders/attachments, and data grid integration.
Main Sheet Inventory tracking with status management and workflow controls like sheet locking.
Booking System with a premium dark-themed calendar supporting multi-VIN appointment scheduling.
Call List management for tracking customer communications with call status monitoring.
Archive module for viewing and restoring historical records with reorder functionality.
AG Grid based reusable Data Grid component with dynamic editing, custom cell renderers, and sorting/filtering.
Global Search capability spanning VINs, customers, part numbers, and companies.
Tabbed Settings Modal for managing Part Statuses, Appearance, Booking Status, and History.
Notification System with badges, direct navigation, and auto-scroll to alert sources.
Row Modals system for editing notes, reminders, and attachments at the grid row level.
Automatic workflow for moving VINs to Call List when all parts have arrived.
Comprehensive state management using Zustand with dedicated slices for each domain.
Reusable UI components built on Radix UI primitives ensuring consistency and accessibility.
Extensive Reporting features including backup reports, scheduling, and recipient management.
user_flow_summary: User logs into the system and is presented with the Dashboard summarizing system metrics and calendar.
From the Dashboard, user navigates to Order Management to create, edit, or bulk update orders via the responsive data grid.
User accesses the Main Sheet Inventory to monitor active inventory status and perform workflow actions such as locking sheets.
Users schedule or view appointments via the Booking Calendar, managing multi-VIN entries and viewing booking history in the sidebar.
Call List allows users to track ongoing calls related to orders and update call statuses accordingly.
Users browse historical data within the Archive module, with options to reorder items back into active Orders.
Global Search enables users to find data matches across all tabs including orders, bookings, and inventory.
Upon receiving notifications, users interact with the Notification System to view alerts and jump directly to affected data entries.
Users open Row Modals to modify notes, reminders, or attachments linked with specific rows in data grids.
Administrators configure application settings in the Settings Modal, adjusting part statuses, themes, and workflow histories.
validation_criteria: All main user interfaces load without errors and display expected data dynamically.
Order Management supports bulk operations and modal interactions for notes/reminders/attachments.
Booking Calendar correctly reflects multi-VIN bookings and updates in real time.
Call List accurately tracks call statuses and allows updates from the UI.
Archive module allows reordering of historical records back to Orders without data loss.
Data Grids implement sorting, filtering, editing, and custom rendering as specified.
Global Search returns accurate results across all domains and respective UI components.
Settings changes in the modal persist correctly and affect system behavior accordingly.
Notifications appear with correct badges and allow seamless navigation and context highlighting.
Workflow automation triggers moving VINs to Call List correctly when all parts arrive.
State management ensures consistent application state across sessions and components.
Automated tests cover critical flows including UI rendering, data operations, and workflows using Vitest and Playwright.
